IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier."},"renounceOwnership()":{"details":"Leaves the contract without owner. must only be called by the user."},"withdrawRefund(uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"This method must only be called by the user."}},"notice":"This contract is the main entry point for users to request services from the Bando protocol.Considerations: The router contract is intended to handle methods to deposit to the escrow cotract to request a service For fulfillments being requested for payment with an ERC20 compliant token, the router will call the depositERC20 method on the ERC20 escrow contract. - The contract is Ownable, Pausable, UUPSUpgradeable, and ReentrancyGuardUpgradeable. - The owner of the contract can set the fulfillable registry, token registry, escrow, and ERC20 escrow addresses. - The owner of the contract is the protocol operator. - The contract is intended to be user-facing. - The contract will validate the request and transfer the payment to the fulfillable contract. - The contract will emit events for each service requested. - The contract will emit an event if the validation of the request fails. - The contract can be paused by the initialize(address).details: Sets up the contract with initial state, including Ownable, Pausable, UUPSUpgradeable, and ReentrancyGuard

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

pause().details: Can only be called by the contract owner

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

requestERC20Service(uint256,(address,uin.details: Validates the request and transfers the payment to the ERC20 escrow contract

params.request: The details of the ERC20 fulfillment request
params.serviceID: The ID of the service being requested

returns._0: bool True if the amount was transferred to the escrow

requestService(uint256,(address,uint256,.details: Validates the request and transfers the payment to the escrow contract

params.request: The details of the fulfillment request
params.serviceID: The ID of the service being requested

returns._0: bool True if the amount was transferred to the escrow

setERC20Escrow(address).details: Can only be called by the contract owner

params.erc20Escrow_: The new address for the ERC20 escrow contract

setEscrow(address).details: Can only be called by the contract owner

params.escrow_: The new address for the escrow contract

setFulfillableRegistry(address).details: Can only be called by the contract owner

params.fulfillableRegistry_: The new address for the fulfillable registry

setTokenRegistry(address).details: Can only be called by the contract owner

params.tokenRegistry_: The new address for the token registry

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

unpause().details: Can only be called by the contract owner

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

_erc20Escrow().notice: The address of the ERC20 escrow contract

_escrow().notice: The address of the escrow contract

_fulfillableRegistry().notice: The address of the fulfillable registry

_tokenRegistry().notice: The address of the token registry

requestService(uint256,(address,uint256,.notice: Requests a service using native tokens

setERC20Escrow(address).notice: Sets the address of the ERC20 escrow contract

setEscrow(address).notice: Sets the address of the escrow contract

setFulfillableRegistry(address).notice: Sets the address of the fulfillable registry

setTokenRegistry(address).notice: Sets the address of the token registry

withdrawERC20Refund(uint256,uint256).notice: This method must only be called by the user.

withdrawRefund(uint256,uint256).notice: This method must only be called by the user.
